intro: Manettia tatei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. Manettia tatei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
